page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: Topography Our D Block is a part of the rural area in the Northampton Uplands north of the County town of Northampton and nearly in the middle of England.The average height is about 300 feet above sea level. Climate:Fairly steady all year round Mean average rainfall 286mm Mean average temperature 15C Geology:Part of the Limestone Escarpment which stretches from Lincolnshire to Dorset.It contains iron deposits,some old quarries where building stone used to be obtained,and a lot of fossils.We found an ammonite but you can see a lot more in Northampton Museum. Transport:The road from Northampton to Market Harborough(A508) passes through it.
